## {{< fa box-open title="an open box" >}} Anticipated deliverable(s) {#anticipated-deliverables}

By the end of today’s workshop, you should have:

- A working draft of your CV 

## {{< fa book-open title="an open book" >}} Learning objectives {#learning-objectives}

By the end of today's workshop, you should be able to:

- Format and design your CV using Bren best practices, including knowing how CV formatting differs slightly from resume formatting. 
- Understand the content typically included in a CV and begin making choices about which content to include in your own CVs. 
- Understand how to assess the audience for your CV, including making formatting, organizational, and content choices to best market your qualifications for the specific audience. 
- Convert an existing resume into a more detailed and/or more academically focused CV, and/or edit an existing CV to create a draft CV for applications that require it (such as for PhD programs, research-focused jobs, or certain fellowships).

## {{< fa plus title="plus" >}} What should I continue working on? {#continue-working}

- [**If having a CV is relevant to your career goals, continue refining it**]{.teal-text} using what you’ve learned in this workshop and by referring to the [Ultimate Bren CV Guide](https://ucsbbren.my.site.com/s/article/Curriculum-Vitae-CV-Guidelines-and-Examples){target="_blank"}. When you’re ready, you’re welcome to request a document review by emailing [medscareer@bren.ucsb.edu](mailto:medscareer@bren.ucsb.edu). We’d be happy to help you further develop and tailor your CV for the positions that interest you.
